posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I've just finished reading the "Shattered Sea" trilogy by Joe Abercrombie, and wondered how to design Thorn, one of the protagonists. (Yes, I know it's a YA series, but the characters and plot stand up well, so there 😋.) She's a young girl training to be a warrior in a man's world in a traditional S&B tradition. She is then introduced to a trainer with a different way of fighting - speed and two weapons - a sword and an axe. She goes on to become the "storm" she is told she must be. She is described as strong and tough, but mostly quick, using her weapons deftly. She's also definitely not a sneaky or trapper type - very much an "in your face" fighter.

And here's the lady in question...

Thorn

So, firstly, this is not supposed to be an optimized build. It's supposed to be able to do as she does. Otherwise I might have gone for a Fighter/ WM/ Rogue - but that didn't give me nearly enough scope. Equally, I know I'm neglecting some of the more obvious Rogue skills for a Dex build - for once I thought I had too many of the things, but I needed 13 Int for other reasons. I'd have quite liked Taunt, but cross-classed it's a bit meh.

You could argue that I've played a bit fast and loose with the character, given I've taken UMD, Spellcraft, and even CoT as a class, but you know how I am about saves. I'm also a little undecided whether to go for Power Attack, Expertise, or Dodge as a level 1 feat. And yes, I know I haven't managed to get Armour Skin in the mix - I went for Crippling Strike instead.

As ever, ladies and gentlemen, your thoughts are welcome!

I'd actually been mulling Rogue and Bard builds through my fat head. And then I came across this little beauty of yours - Tear of the Dragon - and stopped. Hence this one instead.
